summary: The hotel sector continues to face headwinds in the Asia Pacific region due to high interest rates and inflationary pressures, despite ongoing travel momentum contributing to performance in hotel trading performance. As a result, hotel investment volumes have been impacted in APAC, reaching US$5.5bn in Q2 2023, down by 52% from the same period a year ago. Transaction activity this quarter was mostly active in China, Hong Kong and Korea, all three markets representing 80% of the region's total hotel investment volume.
